articles.headline: Iranian Insider and British Spy: How a Double Life Ended on the Gallows
articles.snippet: In January, Iran executed a former senior official who provided Britain with valuable intelligence on Iranian nuclear and military programs over a decade, according to Western intelligence officials.
articles.abstract: In January, Iran executed a former senior official who provided Britain with valuable intelligence on Iranian nuclear and military programs over a decade, according to Western intelligence officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: In April 2008, a senior British intelligence official flew to Tel Aviv to deliver an explosive revelation to his Israeli counterparts: Britain had a mole in Iran with high-level access to the country’s nuclear and defense secrets.
articles.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi and Ronen Bergman

articles.headline: ‘The Godfather of A.I.’ Leaves Google and Warns of Danger Ahead
articles.snippet: For half a century, Geoffrey Hinton nurtured the technology at the heart of chatbots like ChatGPT. Now he worries it will cause serious harm.
articles.abstract: For half a century, Geoffrey Hinton nurtured the technology at the heart of chatbots like ChatGPT. Now he worries it will cause serious harm.
articles.lead_paragraph: Geoffrey Hinton was an artificial intelligence pioneer. In 2012, Dr. Hinton and two of his graduate students at the University of Toronto created technology that became the intellectual foundation for the A.I. systems that the tech industry’s biggest companies believe is a key to their future.

articles.headline: New Orleans Mayor Moves Past Failed Recall Effort, but Unease Persists
articles.snippet: LaToya Cantrell remains in office, but frustration and fatigue among residents have continued to spread as crime remains high and basic services sputter.
articles.abstract: LaToya Cantrell remains in office, but frustration and fatigue among residents have continued to spread as crime remains high and basic services sputter.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — The murder rate in New Orleans had surged, becoming the nation’s highest. Car thefts were nearly constant, basic city services were lagging and critics organized a recall campaign against Mayor LaToya Cantrell, accusing her of giving up on her job.
articles.byline: By Rick Rojas and Katy Reckdahl

articles.headline: In Transylvania, Anyone With $200 Can Live Like a King. (Well, One Specific King.)
articles.snippet: Just don’t expect luxury at the Prince of Wales Guesthouse, where the surrounding forest is the main draw.
articles.abstract: Just don’t expect luxury at the Prince of Wales Guesthouse, where the surrounding forest is the main draw.

articles.headline: Ukraine Wants to Push Forward. Not So Fast, Says Its Black Soupy Mud.
articles.snippet: The unusually wet ground is one obstacle that the Ukrainian military, for all of its ingenuity, is finding difficult to overcome as it prepares for a counteroffensive against Russian forces.
articles.abstract: The unusually wet ground is one obstacle that the Ukrainian military, for all of its ingenuity, is finding difficult to overcome as it prepares for a counteroffensive against Russian forces.
articles.lead_paragraph: The troops of Ukraine’s 43rd Separate Artillery Brigade have just about everything they need to begin the expected spring counteroffensive. They are well rested, have plenty of ammunition and are now in possession of several advanced German-made self-propelled howitzers, which have replaced their old Soviet artillery pieces.
